name: George Washington
description: Commander-in-chief, first President, American Cincinnatus. Tall, dignified bearing with military authority. Known for reserved demeanor, controlled temper, and twice voluntarily relinquishing power.

trenton-commander.name: Commander at Trenton
trenton-commander.description: Based on Trumbull's portrait - standing in victory after the Battle of Trenton
trenton-commander.prompt: standing in Continental Army uniform - blue coat with buff facings, buff waistcoat and breeches, black boots. Hand resting on cannon barrel, American flags and captured Hessian standards behind him. Military bearing, dignified three-quarter pose. The calm after decisive victory at Trenton.

crossing-delaware.name: Crossing the Delaware
crossing-delaware.description: Standing in boat, leading troops across icy river
crossing-delaware.prompt: standing boldly in small boat crossing icy river - Continental Army uniform, cloak billowing, one foot braced on bow. Looking forward toward destiny. Ice floes, struggling oarsmen, American flag. Christmas night 1776, the surprise attack that changed everything.

valley-forge.name: Valley Forge Prayer
valley-forge.description: Kneeling in snow, praying for his army
valley-forge.expression: humble supplication, faith in darkest hour
valley-forge.prompt: kneeling in snow beside his horse - Continental Army cloak wrapped against cold, head bowed in prayer. Bare trees, winter camp in background. The darkest winter of the Revolution. A general on his knees, not commanding but beseeching.

constitutional-chair.name: Constitutional Convention
constitutional-chair.prompt: seated in the rising sun chair at Constitutional Convention - presiding with quiet authority over the deliberations. Delegates gathered below, summer heat of Philadelphia 1787. The half-sun carved on the chair - rising, not setting, on a new nation.
constitutional-chair.energy: deliberative authority, patient leadership, founding moment

inaugural.name: First Inauguration
inaugural.description: Taking the first presidential oath on the Bible
inaugural.prompt: hand on Bible taking the first presidential oath - Federal Hall balcony in New York, crowd below. Adding 'So help me God' to the oath. The precedent-setting moment, every gesture watched for what it would mean for the future.

cincinnatus-returning.name: American Cincinnatus
cincinnatus-returning.description: Surrendering his military commission, returning to farm
cincinnatus-returning.prompt: surrendering military commission to Congress - handing over sword and papers, stepping back from power. Like Cincinnatus returning to his plow. The moment that shocked the world - a victorious general voluntarily becoming a citizen again.
cincinnatus-returning.energy: noble renunciation, republican virtue, power relinquished

mount-vernon.name: At Mount Vernon
mount-vernon.description: The gentleman farmer at his beloved estate
mount-vernon.prompt: standing on Mount Vernon's columned piazza - overlooking the Potomac, gentleman farmer surveying his fields. The estate he loved, the life he wanted - farming, not governing. But duty always called him back.
mount-vernon.energy: pastoral dignity, earned peace, reluctant retirement

surveyor.name: The Surveyor
surveyor.prompt: young Washington with surveyor's tools - theodolite and chain, mapping the Virginia frontier. The precise work that would later help him understand terrain in war. Building his fortune one acre at a time.

farewell-address.name: Farewell Address
farewell-address.description: Delivering his final message to the nation
farewell-address.prompt: elder statesman delivering farewell words - seated at desk with written address, or standing to address the public. Warning against factions and foreign entanglements. The father's final counsel to his political children.

deathbed.name: Final Hours
deathbed.expression: peaceful acceptance, dignity to the end
deathbed.prompt: Washington in his final hours at Mount Vernon - attended by Martha, doctors, and enslaved servants. 'Tis well' his final words. Peaceful, dignified, departing as he lived - with composure.
deathbed.energy: peaceful acceptance, dignified end, legacy secured
